body_html: I'm not sure we would want to allow this. We make the API specifically to call out what you can rely on and what is stable. Anything that it hidden is by definition not part of the API. You can of course always access it directly, but I don't think it's a good idea to expose it into the TensorFlow module.
body_text: I'm not sure we would want to allow this. We make the API specifically to call out what you can rely on and what is stable. Anything that it hidden is by definition not part of the API. You can of course always access it directly, but I don't think it's a good idea to expose it into the TensorFlow module.
body: I'm not sure we would want to allow this. We make the API specifically to call out what you can rely on and what is stable. Anything that it hidden is by definition not part of the API. You can of course always access it directly, but I don't think it's a good idea to expose it into the TensorFlow module.
